description:
Trim contigs based on CDS or domain names or presence of domains in CDSs.

Circular contigs are linearized before trimming.

Typically used for nucleotide sequences, but can be used for protein sequences as well, if you use the 'kb' options to mean 1000 amino acids. CDS and domain options are not supported for protein sequences.

parameters.name: Input
parameters.help: names of input genbank files. If not supplied, reads from stdin.

parameters.name: Output
parameters.help: genbank output file name. If not supplied, writes to stdout.

parameters.name: Kb Both
parameters.help: How many kb to trim from both sides of each contig.

parameters.name: Kb Left
parameters.help: How many kb to trim from the left side of each contig.

parameters.name: Kb Right
parameters.help: How many kb to trim from the right side of each contigs.

parameters.name: Cds Both
parameters.help: How many CDSs to trim from both sides of each contig.

parameters.name: Cds Left
parameters.help: How many CDSs to trim from the left side of each contig.

parameters.name: Cds Right
parameters.help: How many CDSs to trim from the right side of each contig.

parameters.name: Contigs
parameters.help: Only return contigs with these names.

parameters.name: Contigs File
parameters.help: text file containing names of contigs to return.

parameters.name: Domains
parameters.help: Trim CDSs containing domains with these names from the ends of each contig.

parameters.name: No Domain
parameters.help: Trim CDSs containing no domain annotations from the ends of each contig.

parameters.name: Domains File
parameters.help: text file containing names of domains to trim contigs containing.

parameters.name: Domain Expr
parameters.help: a boolean expression using operators & (AND), | (OR), and ~(NOT), to specify a desired combination of domains for CDSs to trim
